Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@Mihailo 

developers.komodoplatform.com is for newcomers to the Komodo ecosystem.

For now, it has only what a newcomer needs to get started, and nothing more.

docs.komodoplatform.com is where everything else goes. 

There's too much documentation for me to manage it all alone. I have other tasks that I'm responsible for, and I don't have that much bandwidth. 

So, docs.komodoplatform.com is just a bin for people who are accustomed to Komodo and don't need any hand holding.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
@Mihailo 

If you add a new CC, I will need to put docs on it in developers.kp

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Those are useful for newcomers.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Np, just wanted to know where will the main docs be for CC!

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: developers.kp

Content:
Please make yourself a branch in the github repo, add whatever you want, and ping me when you are ready.

Or, even better, do a PR, like you suggested for FSM branch.

Content: Those are far easier to manage.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I can pop `result` key and iterate over all others to not hardcode keys (this test checks that R addresses were generated for each field) if there is no risk to miss some 'key' and assume that only addresses will be stored in values (if keys are hardcoded test will detect it)

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @Mihailo That's good to show CC name in key. But I think instead of bracket an undrrscore would be much better. ü§î

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I can do underscore, but I put brackets as it is just an optional descriptor...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @TonyL For parsing I meant whenever you are comparing some text somewhere it is good to do for example lower case for that text and then compare with lower case constant. This way you are avoiding difference in case. Unless it is case sensitive and there can be same text with different case.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Yes mate, I get it's just optional descriptor. But coding Js for sometime I feel `underscore` `_` will suit better for `JSON` key.
